qas.question: What dynasty ruled the Sultanate of Ifat?
What was the capital of the Sultanate of Ifat?
Along with parts of Ethiopia and Somalia, in what modern-day country was the Sultanate of Ifat located?
According to al-Umari, how many cavalry did the Sultanate of Ifat have?
Near what body of water did al-Umari say Ifat was located?

context: The Sultanate of Ifat, led by <a0_0>the Walashma dynasty<a0_0/> with its capital at <a1_0>Zeila<a1_0/>, ruled over parts of what is now eastern Ethiopia, <a2_0>Djibouti<a2_0/>, and northern Somalia. The historian al-Umari records that Ifat was situated near <a4_0>the Red Sea<a4_0/> coast, and states its size as 15 days travel by 20 days travel. Its army numbered <a3_0>15,000<a3_0/> horsemen and 20,000 foot soldiers. Al-Umari also credits Ifat with seven "mother cities": Belqulzar, Kuljura, Shimi, Shewa, Adal, Jamme and Laboo.
